H.R. 7792, The Water Data Act and H.R. 4832, The OpenET Data Act will tackle another component of our drought: data.

The fact is, you can't manage what you can't measure. Lake Mead's water levels are going down fast, and we need to understand where Nevada is losing water.

That means more water in Lake Mead for Nevadans.

But we also have to protect the water flowing into Lake Mead. The Las Vegas Wash carries 200 million gallons of water to Lake Mead daily. H.R. 8415 provides necessary funds to support SNWA's efforts to protect it.

Nevada and California are partnering on one of these projects, and the result will be more water in Lake Mead for Nevadans. 

@SNWA_H2O expects to receive around 25% of the water produced in the form of an exchange of water supply from the Colorado River.

Let's start with H.R. 8434: The Facilitating Large-Scale Water Recycling and Reuse Projects Act.

This legislation builds on my work in the #Infrastructure Investment & Jobs Act to expand funding for large-scale water recycling projects.

But how does this impact Lake Mead?

ICYMI: The House recently passed monumental legislation to tackle the west's worst drought in 12 centuries.

This package includes 5 of my bills that will help keep more water in Lake Mead for Nevadans.

A better funded IRS is a win for our country: fewer audits for you, more money to ensure that everyone plays by the same rules, and billions of dollars to reduce the deficit. It’s one more way that the Democrats' new law is a win for Delaware.

FACT: Roughly half the new IRS funds will be spent on operations, tech modernization, and taxpayer services. Why? Because Americans expect them to be better at reducing backlogs, paying refunds, and correctly dispatching auditors.

FACT: The IRS is not planning on hiring “87,000 new auditors.” What is true? The IRS has lost a third of its employees since 2010. Hiring more staff is intended to fill that gap and create a more efficient team that should be more responsive to taxpayers’ concerns.
FACT: New audits will focus on high-end tax evasion: big corporations and the wealthiest Americans who use loopholes and armies of accountants to avoid paying their fair share.

FACT: The Trump-appointed IRS Commissioner has said that families under that threshold are LESS likely to be audited—‘better technology and customer service would also make it less likely that compliant taxpayers would be audited.'
FACT: The @USTreasury – including the Trump-appointed IRS Commissioner – has made clear that new funding should not increase audit rates on families earning under $400K each year.

I’ve heard from Delawareans concerned about new IRS funding in the Inflation Reduction Act. Here’s the truth: for families earning under $400K and small businesses, the chances of getting audited shouldn't increase. You may even get your refund faster.

Let’s be prepared. Let’s be ready to ensure we beat monkeypox in the United States. Produce the vaccine in the United States now.

As reported by health officials, monkeypox infection can be transmitted by skin-to-skin contact or skin contact with a cloth that has been in contact with infected skin. Implementing the Defense Production Act now to protect the American public in the future is urgently needed.

The evidence is clear that in some parts of the country, many in need of the vaccine are being turned away, and the monkeypox virus is highly infectious. The transmission of the monkeypox infection is not limited to sexual contact.

Because of our history with supply chain disruption during the COVID-19 emergency, we believe it is urgent to implement the Defense Production Act and begin to produce the monkeypox vaccine in our own country.

In early August, I led a letter joined by other Members of Congress written to the President of the United States and health officials in the administration that stated that the monkeypox infection is fast moving in the United States. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FaehFcQX0AIEae8.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FaehFcRXkAAjo7Z.jpg
